column5: I think thats anyones dream day!  some nice looking fish there Ben.
I think thats anyones dream day!  some nice looking fish there Ben.
I think thats anyones dream day!  some nice looking fish there Ben.
Great report!!....some nice lookin' fish you got there
SHAWEEEEET.  thanks for that!  HD
Outstanding

I pretty much had my 'dream' day yesterday.  Plan was to get up early and hit the morning walleye bite on Lac Seul.  Three of us set out from Sioux Lookout on the sleds around 7:30.  Shortly after 8 we were set up.  Within 30 seconds of reaching bottom, the first walleye was on.  The action was fast, lots of active fish around.  Nothing very big, but by 11 we were limited out.  (for those counting.... I had 1 fish at home in the freezer).    So, it's 11am and we're limited out on walleye.  It didn't take us long to decide that we should hit up a lake trout lake for the afternoon.  The laker lake is called Big Vermillion and was a good 25 min sled ride from where we were on Lac Seul.  We got set up again on Big V before noon.  By the time my buddy even had a line in the water I had landed 2 small lakers.  Action was extremely fast when we arrived.        The spot is a reef close to an island that has a steep drop off to a large basin.  Most fish came out of @ 40 FOW.  Action was sporadic.  They would turn on for 15 mins at a time and be chasing and hitting everything then someone hit the off switch and they'd start lazily following our baits but not hitting.      My buddy Graham       Graham with the last fish of the day.   We fished until 5 and packed up.  All the trout today were between 18 and 22" so nothing very big.  I lost a hammer after it took a huge drag screaming run.  Still thinking about that one.   Tube jig was good today and so were gulp plastics on a jig head.  Nothing on metal, spoons or Cicadas etc.  Back at er this afternoon
Nice day Ben.  Gotta love those perfect trips
Nice.   Great fish all round.   I notice you use a swivel for your flouro lead, I do the same thing.   I just for the life of me cannot trust my double uni knots.
very nice indeed.
awsome fish..thats what i would call that a dream day for sure....
Yep, dream day for sure!!!!  The only thing that would better that, would be to catch both lakers and eyes out of the same hole!!!!  Nice fish dude, as always!!  Sinker
Another wonderful day in the North Ben.  Lakers and eyes out of the same hole..... Joey will have to show him that trick! lol
Man I gotta get up there.
That's the way to do it!
Great report and pics Ben  Doesn't get any better than that..... Congratulations to all Real nice eyes and lakers  Thanks for sharing Leechman
SUCKS TO BE ME!!!!!!!!!!   AWESOME TO BE YOU!
Good to see Ben...Keep up the good work and one of these days we'll meet up...sorry I missed ya the other weekend but appertently I didn't really miss that much..unless you like frigid!
Hey Ben  Walleye and Lakers!!  Gotta like it.  I wish there was a place close to Simcoe to Icefish for eating Size Walleye,  I have been to Quinte But mostly the BIG girls there.  Rick
